meanings.definition: Enzymes that catalyze the hydrolysis of phosphomonoester bonds.
meanings.sent1: The phosphomonoesterases in our body help break down certain molecules.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study phosphomonoesterases to understand how they work in cells.
meanings.sent3: The phosphomonoesterases at the enzyme party were the life of the cleavage!
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was like the relentless action of phosphomonoesterases.
meanings.sent5: The phosphomonoesterases acted like tiny scissors, cutting the bonds with precision.

meanings.definition: Proteins that break down phosphomonoester compounds.
meanings.sent1: In the lab, researchers observed how phosphomonoesterases break down compounds.
meanings.sent2: The body relies on phosphomonoesterases to process certain nutrients.
meanings.sent3: The phosphomonoesterases in the protein race were the fastest to break down the compounds.
meanings.sent4: His appetite for knowledge was like the hunger of phosphomonoesterases for compounds.
meanings.sent5: The phosphomonoesterases worked tirelessly, breaking down one compound after another.

meanings.definition: Biological molecules that aid in the cleavage of phosphomonoester linkages.
meanings.sent1: Cells use phosphomonoesterases to help with the cleavage of linkages.
meanings.sent2: The importance of phosphomonoesterases in biological processes cannot be overstated.
meanings.sent3: The phosphomonoesterases in the molecular dance were expertly cutting the linkages.
meanings.sent4: Her leadership skills were like the guiding force of phosphomonoesterases in cleaving linkages.
meanings.sent5: The phosphomonoesterases worked in harmony, ensuring the smooth cleavage of linkages.
